item.source: Please Help..... Cant Get my "runserver.bat" file working

item.title: Please Help..... Cant Get my "runserver.bat" file working
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“zero380, post:9, topic:389002”]i just fixed my “runserver.bat” file but now my compiler is messin with me… right now when i try to run compiler it says…

javac: file not found: *.java usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options finished! press any key to continue . . .

or does that mean it did work? what does that mean lol[/quote]

You need to compile .java not .class. You have your compiler in the wrong directory, it needs to be with JAVA files not CLASS files. The compiler compiles Java into class (Byte code) so it can be read by the server.

The error basically means it cannot find the java files to compile, only if you are using a decompiler would you use the class files. So move your compiler.

Read full topic

or does that mean it did work? what does that mean lol

item.title: Please Help..... Cant Get my "runserver.bat" file working
item.dc:creator: @TheHolyGrail TheHolyGrail
item.description:
@TheHolyGrail wrote:

Did you set your environmental variables?

@echo off
title Project Insanity
java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
pause

That’s mine. See if it works?

item.title: Please Help..... Cant Get my "runserver.bat" file working
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

zero380:

so its my java “path” thats fked up?? idk what to put in there the link u sent didnt relly help

You should know what directory you installed JDK to, find the directory which you put into your compiler and do the same except edit it a little to actually run the server.

item.title: Please Help..... Cant Get my "runserver.bat" file working
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“zero380, post:3, topic:389002”]@echo off
title TestScape Server
java C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6 server
pause

i have windows 7 incase you need to know[/quote]

The PATH needs to lead to your JDK directory (java.exe). Find your JDK directory and then replace it.

@echo off
title TestScape Server
java C:\your\dir\here
pause

As an example (Replace your dir here with the directory). You may also want to read:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
